newsitem.title: UK: Ivory Coast cocoa crop seen at 1 mln ts - PCR.
newsitem.headline: Ivory Coast cocoa crop seen at 1 mln ts - PCR.

text.p: Ivory Coast total cocoa production in the 1996/97 season is likely to be at least one million tonnes, according to managing director Robert Fish of the UK based cocoa research group PCR Ltd.

"I'll bet you Ivorian production is going to be at least one million tonnes. The main crop will turn out a lot better than people expected and with good rains we should get a good mid- crop," he told reporters on the sidelines of a meeting of the International Cocoa Organization (ICCO).
He said the record harvest in 1995/96 was "a fluke" in one sense but it was also a change in the country's production trends.
"It was a combination of trends and exceptionally good weather. We wouldn't have the like of it this year but we will see a damn good crop again," Fish said.
He said the 1996/1997 harvest would its second highest.

Commenting on an estimate made by a senior Ghanaian official of a total domestic crop between 320,000 tonnes and 340,000 tonnes, Fish said, "It is too light...340,000 tonnes maybe, but 320,00 tonnes is too light."
PRC's estimated the crop for Ghana was between 305,000 and 310,000 tonnes for the main crop, excluding the mid crop.
